lead_paragraph: The Chicago Bears released running back Cedric Benson after his second alcohol-related arrest in a month. General Manager Jerry Angelo said in a statement that Benson “displayed a pattern of behavior we will not tolerate.” Three ineffective and injury-plagued years by Benson left management looking for another running back, and that was before his recent brushes with the law.
